page.title: 13Holwell-Local History
page.content: About half of the houses are very old; many more than 200 years old, and 1:3 of these claim to be over 300 years old. The area was part of Blackmore Forest, and the paths through the trees from the clearings to the church can be clearly traced today,as roads and foot -paths. Some old trees remain:notably Gog and Magog,two hollow oaks hundreds of years old,on the road from Sandhills to Glanvilles Wootton,near Round Chimneys Farm. One road through Holwell is thought by some to be pre-Roman.It was certainly used in medieval times by travellers from Sherborne Abbey to Blandford.Travellers from Sherborne to Milton Abbey used it too.Parts of hedges along its route can be seen to be several hundred years old.
